definitions.definition: A hard black enamel varnish containing asphalt.
Lacquerware.
To varnish with japan.

results: A person employed to perform computations; one who computes.
(by restriction) A male computer, where the female computer is called a computress.

A programmable electronic device that performs mathematical calculations and logical operations, especially one that can process, store and retrieve large amounts of data very quickly; now especially, a small one for personal or home use employed for manipulating text or graphics, accessing the Internet, or playing games or media.

A computer is a machine that can be programmed to automatically carry out sequences of arithmetic or logical operations (computation). Modern digital electronic computers can perform generic sets of operations known as programs. These programs enable computers to perform a wide range of tasks. The term computer system may refer to a nominally complete computer that includes the hardware, operating system, software, and peripheral equipment needed and used for full operation; or to a group of computers that are linked and function together, such as a computer network or computer cluster.
Related topics: a computer, a house, an electronic device, communication, a computer
A person employed to perform computations; one who computes.
(by restriction) A male computer, where the female computer is called a computress.

A programmable electronic device that performs mathematical calculations and logical operations, especially one that can process, store and retrieve large amounts of data very quickly; now especially, a small one for personal or home use employed for manipulating text or graphics, accessing the Internet, or playing games or media.

A computer is a machine that can be programmed to automatically carry out sequences of arithmetic or logical operations (computation). Modern digital electronic computers can perform generic sets of operations known as programs. These programs enable computers to perform a wide range of tasks. The term computer system may refer to a nominally complete computer that includes the hardware, operating system, software, and peripheral equipment needed and used for full operation; or to a group of computers that are linked and function together, such as a computer network or computer cluster.
Related topics: a computer, a house, an electronic device, communication, a computer

definitions.definition: Something which lasts for a short period of time.
Lasting for a short period of time.
Existing for only one day, as with some flowers, insects, and diseases.
(of a body of water) Usually dry, but filling with water for brief periods during and after precipitation.
The mental ability to recover quickly from depression, illness or misfortune.
The physical property of material that can resume its shape after being stretched or deformed; elasticity.

The positive capacity of an organizational system or company to adapt and return to equilibrium due to the consequences of a crisis or failure caused by any type of disruption, including: an outage, natural disasters, man-made disasters, terrorism, or similar (particularly IT systems, archives).
A combination of events which have come together by chance to make a surprisingly good or wonderful outcome.
An unsought, unintended, and/or unexpected, but fortunate, discovery and/or learning experience that happens by accident.
The digit or figure 1.
The neutral element with respect to multiplication in a ring.
A one-dollar bill.
One run scored by hitting the ball and running between the wickets; a single.
A joke or amusing anecdote.
A particularly special or compatible person or thing.
definitions.example: I knew as soon I met him that John was the one for me and we were married within a month.

definitions.definition: (leet) Used instead of ! to amplify an exclamation, parodying unskilled typists who forget to press the shift key while typing exclamation points, thus typing "1".
definitions.example: 2003 September 26, "DEAL WITH IT!!!!11one!!", in alt.games.video.nintendo.gamecube, Usenet

definitions.definition: To cause to become one; to gather into a single whole; to unite.
Of a period of time, being particular.
definitions.example: One day the prince set forth to kill the dragon that had brought terror to his father’s kingdom for centuries.

definitions.definition: Being a single, unspecified thing; a; any.
definitions.example: My aunt used to say, "One day is just like the other."

definitions.definition: Sole, only.
definitions.example: He is the one man who can help you.

definitions.definition: Whole, entire.
definitions.example: Body and soul are not separate; they are one.

definitions.definition: In agreement.
definitions.example: We are one on the importance of learning.

definitions.definition: The same.
definitions.example: The two types look very different, but are one species.

definitions.definition: Being a preeminent example.
definitions.example: He is one hell of a guy.

definitions.definition: Being an unknown person with the specified name; see also "a certain".
definitions.example: The town records from 1843 showed the overnight incarceration of one “A. Lincoln”.

definitions.definition: The number represented by the Arabic numeral 1; the numerical value equal to that cardinal number.
definitions.example: In many cultures, a baby turns one year old a year after its birth.

definitions.definition: The first positive number in the set of natural numbers.
The cardinality of the smallest nonempty set.
The ordinality of an element which has no predecessor, usually called first or number one.
(impersonal pronoun, indefinite) One thing (among a group of others); one member of a group.
definitions.example: Any one of the boys.  The big one looks good.  I want the green one.  A good driver is one who drives carefully.

definitions.definition: (impersonal pronoun, sometimes with "the") The first mentioned of two things or people, as opposed to the other.
definitions.example: She offered him an apple and an orange; he took one and left the other.

definitions.definition: (indefinite personal pronoun) Any person (applying to people in general).
definitions.example: One’s guilt may trouble one, but it is best not to let oneself be troubled by things which cannot be changed.  One shouldn’t be too quick to judge.

definitions.definition: (pronoun) Any person, entity or thing.
definitions.example: "driver", noun: one who drives.

examples: I knew as soon I met him that John was the one for me and we were married within a month.
2003 September 26, "DEAL WITH IT!!!!11one!!", in alt.games.video.nintendo.gamecube, Usenet
One day the prince set forth to kill the dragon that had brought terror to his father’s kingdom for centuries.
My aunt used to say, "One day is just like the other."
He is the one man who can help you.
Body and soul are not separate; they are one.
We are one on the importance of learning.
The two types look very different, but are one species.
He is one hell of a guy.
The town records from 1843 showed the overnight incarceration of one “A. Lincoln”.
In many cultures, a baby turns one year old a year after its birth.
Any one of the boys.  The big one looks good.  I want the green one.  A good driver is one who drives carefully.
She offered him an apple and an orange; he took one and left the other.
One’s guilt may trouble one, but it is best not to let oneself be troubled by things which cannot be changed.  One shouldn’t be too quick to judge.
"driver", noun: one who drives.

definitions.definition: State or condition of not meeting a desirable or intended objective, opposite of success.
An object, person or endeavour in a state of failure or incapable of success.
Termination of the ability of an item to perform its required function; breakdown.
Bankruptcy.
To do something; to execute.
definitions.example: It took him only twenty minutes to perform the task.

definitions.definition: To do (something) in front of an audience, such as acting or music, often in order to entertain.
definitions.example: She will perform in the play.

definitions.definition: Something discovered.
definitions.example: This latest discovery should eventually lead to much better treatments for disease.

definitions.definition: The discovering of new things.
definitions.example: Automatic discovery of RSS feeds by a Web browser.

definitions.definition: An act of uncovering or revealing something; a revelation.
A pre-trial phase in which evidence is gathered.
definitions.example: The prosecution moved to suppress certain items turned up during discovery.

definitions.definition: Materials revealed to the opposing party during the pre-trial phase in which evidence is gathered.
definitions.example: The defense argued that the plaintiff's discovery was inadequate.

definitions.definition: Destiny, especially favorable.
definitions.example: She read my fortune. Apparently I will have a good love life this week, but I will have a bad week for money.

definitions.definition: A prediction or set of predictions about a person's future provided by a fortune teller.
A small slip of paper with wise or vaguely prophetic words printed on it, baked into a fortune cookie.
The arrival of something in a sudden or unexpected manner; chance; accident.
Good luck.
definitions.example: Fortune favors the brave.

definitions.definition: One's wealth; the amount of money one has; especially, if it is vast.
definitions.example: He's amassed a small fortune working in the Middle East.

definitions.definition: A large amount of money.
definitions.example: That car must be worth a fortune! How could you afford it?

definitions.definition: To happen, take place.
To provide with a fortune.
To presage; to tell the fortune of.

examples: She read my fortune. Apparently I will have a good love life this week, but I will have a bad week for money.
Fortune favors the brave.
He's amassed a small fortune working in the Middle East.
That car must be worth a fortune! How could you afford it?

definitions.definition: To possess, own.
definitions.example: I have a house and a car.

definitions.definition: To hold, as something at someone's disposal.
definitions.example: Do you have the key? (not necessarily one's own key)

definitions.definition: Used to state the existence or presence of someone in a specified relationship with the subject.
definitions.example: I have a really mean boss.

definitions.definition: To partake of (a particular substance, especially food or drink, or action or activity).
definitions.example: Can I have a look at that?

definitions.definition: To be scheduled to attend, undertake or participate in.
definitions.example: Fred won't be able to come to the party; he has a meeting that day.

definitions.definition: To experience, go through, undergo.
definitions.example: He had surgery on his hip yesterday.

definitions.definition: To be afflicted with, suffer from.
definitions.example: He had a cold last week.

definitions.definition: (auxiliary verb, taking a past participle) Used in forming the perfect aspect.
definitions.example: I had already eaten.

definitions.definition: Used as an interrogative verb before a pronoun to form a tag question, echoing a previous use of 'have' as an auxiliary verb or, in certain cases, main verb. (For further discussion, see the appendix English tag questions.)
definitions.example: They haven't eaten dinner yet, have they?

definitions.definition: (auxiliary verb, taking a to-infinitive) See have to.
definitions.example: I have to go.

definitions.definition: To give birth to.
definitions.example: My mother had me when she was 25.

definitions.definition: To engage in sexual intercourse with.
definitions.example: He's always bragging about how many women he's had.

definitions.definition: To accept as a romantic partner.
definitions.example: Despite my protestations of love, she would not have me.

definitions.definition: (transitive with bare infinitive) To cause to, by a command, request or invitation.
definitions.example: They had me feed their dog while they were out of town.

definitions.definition: (transitive with adjective or adjective-phrase complement) To cause to be.
definitions.example: He had him arrested for trespassing.

definitions.definition: (transitive with bare infinitive) To be affected by an occurrence. (Used in supplying a topic that is not a verb argument.)
definitions.example: I've had three people today tell me my hair looks nice.

definitions.definition: (transitive with adjective or adjective-phrase complement) To depict as being.
definitions.example: Their stories differed; he said he'd been at work when the incident occurred, but her statement had him at home that entire evening.

definitions.definition: To defeat in a fight; take.
definitions.example: I could have him!

definitions.definition: (obsolete outside Ireland) To be able to speak (a language).
definitions.example: I have no German.

definitions.definition: To feel or be (especially painfully) aware of.
definitions.example: Dan certainly has arms today, probably from scraping paint off four columns the day before.

definitions.definition: To trick, to deceive.
definitions.example: You had me alright! I never would have thought that was just a joke.

definitions.definition: (often with present participle) To allow; to tolerate.
definitions.example: I asked my dad if I could go to the concert this Thursday, but he wouldn't have it since it's a school night.

definitions.definition: (often used in the negative) To believe, buy, be taken in by.
definitions.example: I made up an excuse as to why I was out so late, but my wife wasn't having any of it.

definitions.definition: To host someone; to take in as a guest.
definitions.example: Thank you for having me!

definitions.definition: To get a reading, measurement, or result from an instrument or calculation.
definitions.example: I have two contacts on my scope.

definitions.definition: (of a jury) To consider a court proceeding that has been completed; to begin deliberations on a case.
definitions.example: We'll schedule closing arguments for Thursday, and the jury will have the case by that afternoon.

definitions.definition: To make an observation of (a bird species).

I have no German.

You had me alright! I never would have thought that was just a joke.

I made up an excuse as to why I was out so late, but my wife wasn't having any of it.
Thank you for having me!
I have two contacts on my scope.
We'll schedule closing arguments for Thursday, and the jury will have the case by that afternoon.

definitions.definition: A thing that people want; something that is desirable.
definitions.example: There are plenty of desirables on display in the window.

definitions.definition: Worthy to be desired; pleasing; agreeable.
definitions.example: This applicant has almost all desirable properties.

examples: There are plenty of desirables on display in the window.
This applicant has almost all desirable properties.

definitions.definition: A person or group of people constituting a particular side in a contract or legal action.
definitions.example: The contract requires that the party of the first part pay the fee.

definitions.definition: A person.
A group of people forming one side in a given dispute, contest etc.
A political group considered as a formal whole, united under one specific political platform of issues and campaigning to take part in government.
definitions.example: The green party took 12% of the vote.

definitions.definition: A discrete detachment of troops, especially for a particular purpose.
definitions.example: The settlers were attacked early next morning by a scouting party.

definitions.definition: A group of persons collected or gathered together for some particular purpose.
A part or division.
To celebrate at a party, to have fun, to enjoy oneself.
definitions.example: We partied until the early hours.

definitions.definition: To take recreational drugs.
To engage in flings, to have one-night stands, to sow one's wild oats.
To form a party (with).
definitions.example: If you want to beat that monster, you should party with a healer.

examples: The contract requires that the party of the first part pay the fee.
The green party took 12% of the vote.
The settlers were attacked early next morning by a scouting party.
We partied until the early hours.
If you want to beat that monster, you should party with a healer.

definitions.definition: To cut a notch or a groove in a surface.
definitions.example: The baker scored the cake so that the servers would know where to slice it.

definitions.definition: To record the tally of points for a game, a match, or an examination.
To obtain something desired.
To provide (a film, etc.) with a musical score.

examples: The baker scored the cake so that the servers would know where to slice it.

definitions.definition: To last, continue, endure.
For all of a given time interval.
definitions.example: I lived with my parents during the 1970s.

definitions.definition: At any time or period within a given time interval.
definitions.example: I lived with my parents at several points during the 1980s.

examples: I lived with my parents during the 1970s.
I lived with my parents at several points during the 1980s.

definitions.definition: That which has a distinct existence as an individual unit. Often used for organisations which have no physical form.
The existence of something considered apart from its properties.
Anything about which information or data can be stored in a database; in particular, an organised array or set of individual elements or parts.
The state or quality of being or existence.
definitions.example: The group successfully maintains its tribal entity.

definitions.definition: A spirit, ghost, or the like.
An alien lifeform that has no corporeal body.
Toward a closed, touching or engaging position.
definitions.example: Please push the door to.

definitions.definition: Into the wind.
Indicating destination: In the direction of, and arriving at.
definitions.example: We are walking to the shop.

definitions.definition: Used to indicate the target or recipient of an action.
definitions.example: He devoted himself to education.

definitions.definition: Used to indicate result of action.
definitions.example: His face was beaten to a pulp.

definitions.definition: Used to indicate a resulting feeling or emotion.
definitions.example: To everyone's great relief, the tuneless carol singers finally ceased their warbling.

definitions.definition: Used after an adjective to indicate its application.
definitions.example: similar to ..., relevant to ..., pertinent to ..., I was nice to him, he was cruel to her, I am used to walking.

definitions.definition: Denotes the end of a range.
definitions.example: It takes 2 to 4 weeks to process typical applications.

definitions.definition: As a.
definitions.example: With God to friend (with God as a friend);   with The Devil to fiend (with the Devil as a foe);   lambs slaughtered to lake (lambs slaughtered as a sacrifice);   took her to wife (took her as a wife);   was sold to slave (was sold as a slave).

definitions.definition: Used to indicate a ratio or comparison.
definitions.example: I have ten dollars to your four.

definitions.definition: Used to indicate that the preceding term is to be raised to the power of the following value; indicates exponentiation.
definitions.example: Three squared or three to the second power is nine.

definitions.definition: (time) Preceding.
definitions.example: ten to ten = 9:50; We're going to leave at ten to (the hour).

definitions.definition: Used to describe what something consists of or contains.
definitions.example: Anyone could do this job; there's nothing to it.

definitions.definition: At.
definitions.example: Stay where you're to and I'll come find you, b'y.

examples: Please push the door to.
We are walking to the shop.
He devoted himself to education.
His face was beaten to a pulp.
To everyone's great relief, the tuneless carol singers finally ceased their warbling.
similar to ..., relevant to ..., pertinent to ..., I was nice to him, he was cruel to her, I am used to walking.
It takes 2 to 4 weeks to process typical applications.

With God to friend (with God as a friend);   with The Devil to fiend (with the Devil as a foe);   lambs slaughtered to lake (lambs slaughtered as a sacrifice);   took her to wife (took her as a wife);   was sold to slave (was sold as a slave).
I have ten dollars to your four.
Three squared or three to the second power is nine.
ten to ten = 9:50; We're going to leave at ten to (the hour).
Anyone could do this job; there's nothing to it.
Stay where you're to and I'll come find you, b'y.

definitions.definition: The name of the Latin script letter A/a.
One

examples: get full disclosure

definitions.definition: (gerund) The act of persons or things that meet.
definitions.example: Meeting him will be exciting. I enjoy meeting new people.

definitions.definition: A gathering of persons for a purpose; an assembly.
definitions.example: We need to have a meeting about that soon.

definitions.definition: (collective) The people at such a gathering.
definitions.example: What has the meeting decided.

definitions.definition: An encounter between people, even accidental.
definitions.example: They came together in a chance meeting on the way home from work.

definitions.definition: A place or instance of junction or intersection; a confluence.
definitions.example: Earthquakes occur at the meeting of tectonic plates.

definitions.definition: A religious service held by a charismatic preacher in small towns in the United States.
An administrative unit in the Religious Society of Friends (Quakers).
definitions.example: Denver meeting is a part of Intermountain yearly meeting.

examples: Meeting him will be exciting. I enjoy meeting new people.
We need to have a meeting about that soon.
What has the meeting decided.
They came together in a chance meeting on the way home from work.
Earthquakes occur at the meeting of tectonic plates.
Denver meeting is a part of Intermountain yearly meeting.

definitions.definition: One who is morally or mentally weak or inefficient; an imbecile; a simpleton.
Not capable (of doing something); unable.
definitions.example: A pint glass is incapable of holding more than a pint of liquid.

definitions.definition: Not in a state to receive; not receptive; not susceptible; not able to admit.
definitions.example: incapable of pain, or pleasure; incapable of stain or injury

examples: A pint glass is incapable of holding more than a pint of liquid.
incapable of pain, or pleasure; incapable of stain or injury

definitions.definition: Suitableness.
The quality or state of being able; capacity to do or of doing something; having the necessary power.
definitions.example: This phone has the ability to have its software upgraded wirelessly.

definitions.definition: The legal wherewithal to act.
Physical power.
Financial ability.
A unique power of the mind; a faculty.
A skill or competence in doing; mental power; talent; aptitude.
definitions.example: She has an uncanny ability to defuse conflict.

examples: This phone has the ability to have its software upgraded wirelessly.
She has an uncanny ability to defuse conflict.

definitions.definition: A preliminary trial held in advance of a court trial.
Pertaining to a preliminary trial.
Before a trial.
One who is neither a he nor a she; a creature; a dehumanized being.
The person who chases and tries to catch the other players in the playground game of tag.
definitions.example: In the next game, Adam and Tom will be it…

definitions.definition: The game of tag.
definitions.example: Let's play it at breaktime.

definitions.definition: Sex appeal, especially that which goes beyond beauty.
Sexual activity.
definitions.example: caught them doing it

definitions.definition: A biological force that inhabits living beings, according to the vitalist approach of Georg Groddeck.
The one (or ones) belonging to it.

examples: In the next game, Adam and Tom will be it…
Let's play it at breaktime.
caught them doing it

definitions.definition: Facts or observations presented in support of an assertion.
definitions.example: There is no evidence that anyone was here earlier.

definitions.definition: Anything admitted by a court to prove or disprove alleged matters of fact in a trial.
One who bears witness.
A body of objectively verifiable facts that are positively indicative of, and/or exclusively concordant with, that one conclusion over any other.
To provide evidence for, or suggest the truth of.
definitions.example: She was furious, as evidenced by her slamming the door.

examples: There is no evidence that anyone was here earlier.
She was furious, as evidenced by her slamming the door.

definitions.definition: To ask (someone) for something; to request.
To demand, to insist upon (having); to call for authoritatively.
Naturally to demand (something) as indispensable; to need, to call for as necessary.
To demand of (someone) to do something.
Necessary; obligatory; mandatory.
An individual; usually a human being.
definitions.example: Each person is unique, both mentally and physically.

definitions.definition: The physical body of a being seen as distinct from the mind, character, etc.
Any individual or formal organization with standing before the courts.
definitions.example: At common law a corporation or a trust is legally a person.

definitions.definition: The human genitalia; specifically, the penis.
(grammar) A linguistic category used to distinguish between the speaker of an utterance and those to whom or about whom he or she is speaking. See grammatical person.
A shoot or bud of a plant; a polyp or zooid of the compound Hydrozoa, Anthozoa, etc.; also, an individual, in the narrowest sense, among the higher animals.
To represent as a person; to personify; to impersonate.
(gender-neutral) To man.

examples: Each person is unique, both mentally and physically.
At common law a corporation or a trust is legally a person.

definitions.definition: Connects at least two alternative words, phrases, clauses, sentences, etc. each of which could make a passage true. In English, this is the "inclusive or." The "exclusive or" is formed by "either [...] or".
definitions.example: He might get cancer, or be hit by a bus, or God knows what.

definitions.definition: An operator denoting the disjunction of two propositions or truth values. There are two forms, the inclusive or and the exclusive or.
Counts the elements before and after as two possibilities.
Otherwise (a consequence of the condition that the previous is false).
definitions.example: It's raining! Come inside or you'll catch a cold!

definitions.definition: Connects two equivalent names.
definitions.example: The country Myanmar, or Burma

examples: He might get cancer, or be hit by a bus, or God knows what.
It's raining! Come inside or you'll catch a cold!
The country Myanmar, or Burma

definitions.definition: An opportunity or possibility.
definitions.example: We had the chance to meet the president last week.

definitions.definition: Random occurrence; luck.
definitions.example: Why leave it to chance when a few simple steps will secure the desired outcome?

definitions.definition: The probability of something happening.
definitions.example: There is a 30 percent chance of rain tomorrow.

definitions.definition: What befalls or happens to a person; their lot or fate.
Happening by chance, casual.
Perchance; perhaps.

examples: We had the chance to meet the president last week.
Why leave it to chance when a few simple steps will secure the desired outcome?
There is a 30 percent chance of rain tomorrow.

definitions.definition: Lasting for only a moment.
Happening at every moment; perpetual.
Ephemeral or relatively short-lived.
Alive or existent for only a short period of time.
A chance for advancement, progress or profit.
definitions.example: The world is full of opportunities and it's up to me to see them and pursue them.

definitions.definition: A favorable circumstance or occasion.
definitions.example: Having a holiday is a great opportunity to relax.

definitions.definition: (Euro-English) opportuneness
definitions.example: The Court questioned the opportunity of introducing these measures in such an uncertain economic climate.

examples: The world is full of opportunities and it's up to me to see them and pursue them.
Having a holiday is a great opportunity to relax.
The Court questioned the opportunity of introducing these measures in such an uncertain economic climate.

definitions.definition: To float.
To pass over rapidly; to skim the surface of.
definitions.example: a ship that fleets the gulf

definitions.definition: To hasten over; to cause to pass away lightly, or in mirth and joy.
To flee, to escape, to speed away.
To evanesce, disappear, die out.
To move up a rope, so as to haul to more advantage; especially to draw apart the blocks of a tackle.
(of people) To move or change in position.
To shift the position of dead-eyes when the shrouds are become too long.
To cause to slip down the barrel of a capstan or windlass, as a rope or chain.
To take the cream from; to skim.
Passing quickly; of short duration.

examples: a ship that fleets the gulf

definitions.definition: Objects that are designed to be short-lived.
definitions.example: vintage ephemera

definitions.definition: (library science) Published single-sheet or single page documents which are meant to be thrown away after one use.
(by extension) Transitory audiovisual matter not intended to be retained or preserved.
definitions.example: audio ephemera

definitions.definition: Something short-lived or transitory.
A type of weak reference in a garbage collected programming language that does not permit an object to be kept alive by its finalizer.

examples: vintage ephemera
audio ephemera

definitions.definition: Disappearing, vanishing.
Barely there; almost imperceptible.
Ephemeral, fleeting, momentary.
A chemical or compound that changes into a gas easily.
Evaporating or vaporizing readily under normal conditions.
(of a substance) Explosive.
(of a price etc) Variable or erratic.
(of a person) Quick to become angry or violent.
Fickle.
Temporary or ephemeral.
(of a situation) Potentially violent.
(of a variable) Having its associated memory immediately updated with any changes in value.
(of memory) Whose content is lost when the computer is powered down
Passing through the air on wings, or by the buoyant force of the atmosphere; flying; having the power to fly.
One serving for a limited time; short-term employee.
Not permanent; existing only for a period or periods of time.
Existing only for a short time or short times; transient, ephemeral.
Lasting only a short time; temporary.
Of an action: that may be brought in any county
Measuring a small distance or duration.
definitions.example: A short walk.

examples: Short time.
Short story.

definitions.definition: A writ summoning one to answer to any action.
An answer to any action.
A memorandum of points of fact or of law for use in conducting a case.
(by extension) A position of interest or advocacy.
An attorney's legal argument in written form for submission to a court.
(English law) The material relevant to a case, delivered by a solicitor to the barrister who tries the case.
A short news story or report.
definitions.example: We got a news brief.

definitions.definition: (usually in the plural) undershorts briefs.
definitions.example: I wear boxers under trousers but for sports I usually wear a brief.

definitions.definition: A summary, précis or epitome; an abridgement or abstract.
A letter patent, from proper authority, authorizing a collection or charitable contribution of money in churches, for any public or private purpose.
(slang) A ticket of any type.
To summarize a recent development to some person with decision-making power.
definitions.example: The U.S. president was briefed on the military coup and its implications on African stability.

definitions.definition: To write a legal argument and submit it to a court.
Of short duration; happening quickly.
definitions.example: Her reign was brief but spectacular.

definitions.definition: Concise; taking few words.
definitions.example: His speech of acceptance was brief but moving.

definitions.definition: Occupying a small distance, area or spatial extent; short.
definitions.example: Her skirt was extremely brief but doubtless cool.

definitions.definition: Rife; common; prevalent.
Briefly.
Soon; quickly.

examples: We got a news brief.
I wear boxers under trousers but for sports I usually wear a brief.
The U.S. president was briefed on the military coup and its implications on African stability.
Her reign was brief but spectacular.
His speech of acceptance was brief but moving.
Her skirt was extremely brief but doubtless cool.

definitions.definition: Something which lasts for a short period of time.
Lasting for a short period of time.
Existing for only one day, as with some flowers, insects, and diseases.
(of a body of water) Usually dry, but filling with water for brief periods during and after precipitation.
